Reviews.Title: “Non-secure long term parking”
Reviews.Author: K L
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel based on their advertising as a secure park and fly location. Unfortunately what is advertised is not what you get. We were required to park is a grass field located next to the hotel. There are no lights, no fence and no security camera's. Our vehicle was vandalized. Upon speaking with staff, this was not the first incident. Management, was cordial, but would not accept responsibility for the security of the vehicles. We would not recommend staying, as it is not safe.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good night so far”
Reviews.Author: wilwilwil
Reviews.Content: We are staying here because we have an early flight in the morning. 630 am to be precise. The hotel is nice and the girl at the front desk was ok. Hallways and rooms are very nicely done. Feels high end.  The problem is the noise. The wall AC unit does not have operating controls. It is linked to the thermostat. I cant just turn on the fan for white noise. With I-65 a few hundred feet away, this is a BIG problem. I'm not even on the wing closest to the freeway! There's freeway noise, there's a guy grunting in the next room, and the blackout shades dont cover the windows around the edges at all. I could look the other way but there is a smoke detector or something that is a very bright light flashing every FOUR seconds. Is that really necessary? They should flash once a minute or something. And the bed is caved in, so i'm rolling to the middle. This is already a terrible night and I'm not asleep yet. I would definitely not recommend this place if you want a good night's sleep before traveling. Find somewhere else further from the highways.

Reviews.Title: “Management could care less!”
Reviews.Author: Midwesterner0910
Reviews.Content: 4th stay at this hotel and will definitely be the last. Chose this hotel for the park and fly benefit and had to end up catching a cab back to hotel at 1130pm on Sat night. We were given written instructions to wait at zone 2 after calling hotel for pick up. Waited approx 30 min no van. Called again, was told by desk clerk van was on it's way and to wait at zone 2, and our name had been given to the driver. 15 min later van arrived at zone 1 as far away from zone 2 as possible, by the time we took our luggage down to zone 1, the van was filled (van only holds 7 people) was told by driver that a gold car was available to take more passengers and 4 people hopped into this car and left. The gold car had no Comfort Suite logo on it, for all we knew it was somebody's own personal vehicle from the hotel. After waiting a total of 45 min. took a cab for a 10 min ride back to hotel which costs 23.00. So to sum it up, 1 van for 7 people during 45 min period and the hotel is only 10 min away. Upon arrival at hotel, asked to speak to manager and was told the manager was the shuttle driver and couldn't be reached. Hmm. Asked for managers name and the desk clerk stated he just knew his first name, gave me a card with a name on it. Informed desk clerk that we would like to speak to manager about this matter and was told that he would contact us in the morning At the same time a couple was being told that there confirmed reservation was invalid because the hotel was booked. They too were asking to speak to the manager and were getting the run around, "unable to contact him" was what they were told. Next morning at check out, man in lobby vacuuming, no one at desk, rang bell for service, woman appeared and we asked if the manager was available. She immediately looked down at the floor and then to man and asks "may I help you," again, "is the manger in, that's a yes or no question." The woman looked over at the man vacuuming and we approached the man and evidently, he was the manager. We informed him about the transportation issue and how we were told we would be contacted the following morning. He didn't appear to be the least bit interested and acted like that was the norm at this hotel. Asked him about the couple without a room and he said he "didn"t know anything about it." All we wanted was reimbursement for the cab and an apology for poor transportation service. We got neither and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “yeah comfort”
Reviews.Author: rh55
Reviews.Content: comfort suites near the airport is clean, with great staff. good breakfast with a large sitting area. nice rooms. free shuttle to aiport with park & stay packages while on your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful where your room is located”
Reviews.Author: gramps-nanna
Reviews.Content: Spent three night here while in town on business. The hotel was clean and comfortable, and the bedding was comfortable, the soap in all choice hotels lately reminds me of old type Lava soap.....it leaves a lot to be disired. The pillows at the chain are universally terrible, but you know and expect that at a choice hotel. I was in a group of about 30 people who had 15 rooms. The hotel is tight up against an interstate and the folks who were lucky enough to get a room away from the interstate slept well, others were not as lucky. Breakfast was typical and the lady functioning as the breakfast hostess refused to acknowledg anyone or engage anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Barbara42207
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attending the Big 10 Championship. This Comfort Suites was clean, the staff friendly and helpful, the breakfast satisfactory. The front desk help asnswered our questions and called a taxi for us. (I wish someone would have brought the aiport shuttle van to pick us up at 2 am when I called to ask for suggestions on how to get a taxi back to the hotel. That is a suggestion during a busy event.) This site is a very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sue s
Reviews.Content: Room was so so.. sure it was huge but could use a bit more cleaning.. crumbs were in the pull out sofa couch.. there was stains on the mattress.. the sheets did not look clean at all. The management is horrible. Ram is not a nice guy at all and could care less about anything other than getting your money. Breakfast was not good at all. Half of the stuff was empty at 8am. You try to talk to the girl running the breakfast and she can not understand you as she does not speak english. She is to busy doing all the other jobs around the hotel then tending to the breakfast area. When I asked the manager about the food she said you can go down the street if you are that hungry. I stay at choice hotels all the time and I have never experianced anything like this in all my stays. Worst choice hotel EVER!!!! Do not stay if you can avoid at all cost. This has almost put such a bad taste in my mouth to never stay at another choice hotel again because they have places like this!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Halinka_podrozniczka
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. Good service, nice and large rooms, location convenient for those who have to catch a flight from the Indianapolis airport.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Edward S
Reviews.Content: Had never been to this hotel before, but the reviews were very favorable. This was true, the people were very friendly, the morning breakfast was good, the beds comfortable. This hotel has easy access to the downtown area. The inroom microwave and refrigerator are a plus.

Reviews.Title: “One Big Problem: Bad Internet”
Reviews.Author: lakecityransom
Reviews.Content: The room size is awesome. Breakfast is not skimpy. I had two problems: 1. Hot tub was lukewarm water... I mentioned this and they fixed it. No big deal. (p.s. they have a sauna as well as a pool/hot tub). 2. The Internet was out at times. You could connect to the router but no Internet. The thing that really sucks is that you're capped at 60kb/s. If you don't know speed terms well lets just say you can't stream any videos like Youtube realtime. You have to pause them and wait awhile. Typically Choice places give you 150kb-200kb. Not a big deal if you're not a big Internet user. About breakfast: Expect sausage patties and egg patties and then the next day will be egg patties and biscuits and a pot of gravy.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Airtport Lodging Close to Downtown and Zoo”
Reviews.Author: kgilbert78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a trip to Indy to visit the indianapolis Zoo. We had a jacuzzi suite. The suite was large and we had plenty of towels. The bedding was standard for this chain, which means very good, with plenty of pillows. The staff was great and very friendly and helpful. Two minuses. We had a lot of trouble getting the WiFi internet to work. This may have been a problem with our computer but may also have been due to the number of guests. One night we were not bale to log in at all. This may stem from many places now using an interim page with password to get you to the net--these do not always pop up correctly. The second negative was late night noise from cargo jets entering/leaving the airport. It woke me around 4 on Friday morning, though I slept better on Saturday night. You may want earplugs. Note that this location does not have later hours for the free breakfast on the weekends. Breakfast was acceptable with eggs and waffles as well as the normal cold items.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for ease of early or late airline arrivals-departures.”
Reviews.Author: Cathleen D
Reviews.Content: We recently spent the night here prior to leaving early the next morning for vacation. The shuttle took us to the airport as requested, and we left our car for no charge on the grounds, with some of our things in the safe, for pick up on our return. On our way back the shuttle picked us up promptly. The room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommened”
Reviews.Author: Imgelem
Reviews.Content: We were on a road trip and had a chance to experience so many different hotels. So far this hotel turned out to be one of the best stays we had within 15 day trip. Way better than what we expected. It is clean, comfortable, nicely decorated and quiet. We were worrying about our car but everything was fine and safe too. Great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Please...stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Allison R
Reviews.Content: My husband & I usually enjoy our stay at Comfort Suites, Choice Hotels. However, this was a horriable experience and we will not be coming back nor do we suggest others to stay here. They have poor customer service & a very rude manager (Ram). The parking was terrible, we had to park in a gravel lot & walk far just to get to hotel. People were partying in the parking lot, along with employees that just got off work & chain smoking non-stop. We were thankful we only had to stayed one night. Then, when we got home we realized that we had been billed twice because the way we booked it , they said. The manager would not refund us the $100 dollars for the suppose additional room. Other reviewers have mentioned this before & said, "they realize it's an issue & still continue to get away with it." They are charging additional fees & with no regard for keeping future customers. We have contacted the general manger (Ram) & he does not seem to have any sympathy about the matter. We are going to talk to the credit card company & see if we can fight this charge. I have heard scam hotels like this before & never experienced it until we stayed here. Make a good decision for you & your family & stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Easy access from IND airport, comfortable bed and suite”
Reviews.Author: marathon308
Reviews.Content: A free airport shuttle (better call them from airport to verify, tend to stop before midnight). Easy access outside the city and free parking. Breakfast is common, good indoor swimming pool and fitness room. Very comfortable bed, a spacious suite. 61 $ reserved directly at choicehotels.com . Some odor in the corridor. Good Wifi, sometimes reception desk is slow.

Reviews.Title: “Already planned two more trip here... great”
Reviews.Author: kgpittm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night in August when I was coming and going from the Indianapolis Airport. The free shuttle was reasonably fast, but the reason this is easily a five-star hotel for me is the value for the room I had. I paid less than I normally pay for Sleep or Comfort Inn and the room was the best I've seen in the Choice chain of hotels (I have not stayed at any Cambria). Access to the hotel is a little more difficult and I can see where parking may be an issue, but I not only would stay here again, but I already have two more stays booked here. I just hope all the positive reviews don't lead to price increases!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: lyketotravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, flying in to see a friend. Was a toss-up between the Comfort Inn or the Comfort Suites. I decided on the Comfort Suites based on what I saw posted here. Was a good choice. Room was spacious, bed was very comfortable, the place was clean, had a pool, jacuzzi, and dry sauna. They serve a hot (not continental) breakfast, which means waffles, eggs, sausage in addition to cereal, bagels, muffins, and coffee. For me, it filled the void. The staff was very helpful and friendly. While the place does provide an airport shuttle, you will need a rental car to get something to eat outside of breakfast as there is nothiing, repeat nothing, within even an unreasonable walking distance from the hotel. It is close to the airport, although the current construction makes it an obstacle course to get there. But for the price and the room you get, a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value...and I'm a tightwad”
Reviews.Author: born2go
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed in a assesible room (he uses a walker) and the room was HUGE and located next to the elevator. Although this sounds like it should be a no brainer, we have stayed in many hotels in which the assessible rooms were WAAAY at the end of the hall. The room had every comfort you could want. 2 flat screened TVs, microwave, fridge, very comfy beds and nice linens. The beds were a bit high for my father to get into, but he figured out a way to maneuver himself. It might be more difficult if you are completely dependent however. Maybe I'm not that fussy about food, but I thought the breakfast was pretty good. Make your owns waffles, a tasty omlette- like egg, muffins, yogurts, cereals,apple and orange juice. One morning there were patty sauages. The indoor pool was very nice. There was also a lovely hot tub and a sauna. The fitness room was so-so. I always use the fitness room and I couldn't get either treadmills to work. There was an eliptical Nordic Trak that worked well so it wasn't a problem. The staff may have been able to resolve the problem but I didn't ask. As others have said, parking is somewhat limited here. There is lots of construction currently on I-465 and the expressway ramps which makes it a bit difficult if you want to access I-465 South from hotel. It wasn't a problem for me as I used to live in Indy and familar with the surrounding roads, but it may be off putting for those travelers unfamiliar with the area. The staff was very friendly and management very polite. We arrived before checkiin time and the desk clerk called upstairs to housekeeping to check if one of the assessible rooms was cleaned and ready. (it was) There really isn't much in the way of restaurants in the immediate area. All in all, a very nice, comfortable stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinArtie
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel a week ago. The hotel seemed like it was brand new. The room was big, clean and the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast in the morning had many choices. We used the laundry facilities and the pool. Unfortunately, the pool closed at 10 pm. (We checked-in around 9:30.) The kids only had about 10 minutes in the water when the clerk told us the pool was closing. The parking lot to this hotel was small. Many travelers had to park on in the driveway. And if you're looking for a nearby restaurant, we didn't see one. But I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience. Some trouble parking.”
Reviews.Author: The8racer
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, helpful & pleasant staff. Also quite a good value. Front desk staff granted my request for a late check out due to the hours I had to work while in town and amazingly housekeeping did NOT attempt to enter my room as has happened so often at other locations. Only downer was that zero parking was available since I was the last one in. Standard Comfort breakfast which could be improved across the board but that's not the fault of this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a beautiful new hotel!”
Reviews.Author: St9sking
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on a recent business trip to Indianapolis. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and welcomed me on arrival and was very accommodating. The rooms were very clean and the beds were amazingly comfortable with upscale linens and GREAT COMFY pillows! This location was “upscale” for a Comfort Suites location. I would highly recommend this hotel. ( I usually stay at a competitor hotel nearby – that is much more expensive).. and I was very pleased with my overall experience at this Comfort Suites location.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T PLAN ON STAYING THERE AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: ovrmyd
Reviews.Content: I checked to make sure we could leave our car at this hotel before booking. When checking the manager told me for a fee I could leave the car and the airport would cost more. I ask for a phone book to check the airport cost and the manager then told me I could leave the car there at no cost. When we returned from our trip the people above was VERY LOUD ALL NIGHT! We called down to the desk at 1:00 a.m. and told them, finally at about 4:00 it was quite for a short time. We left our 5 year old girls blanket at the hotel and did not miss it till we got home. So we called the hotel and ask if it could be sent to us, for a fee of $10. PLEASE, it could of been put into a bubble envelope and sent for half the cost. When I ask if they could do that the manager got on the phone and TOLD me our fee is $10 more matter. I told him that was a little much, he then told me (in a very RUDE tone) we could hold it for 2 months if you want to dirve back down to get it. I told him he was being rude and to ship the blanket home. I guess customer service means nothing to him. I guess all in all the service left a LOT to be improved upon to say the least! We have done a LOT of traveling and never at a manager be so RUDE to us.

Reviews.Title: “What a RIP-OFF!!”
Reviews.Author: topaz2456
Reviews.Content: We booked a reservation on expedia for what we THOUGHT was the Comfort INN in plainfield. Went directly to the hotel (less than 30 minutes after making the reservation), found out it was the wrong hotel. TRIED to cancel the reservation immediately, and was CHARGED a $91.00 penalty!! Hotel said cancellation had to be MORE than 24 hours in advance to avoid the fee. Didn't even MAKE the reservation more than 24 hours in advance!!!, and yet they still would NOT budge on waiving the fee!! WHAT A RIP-OFF!!!! We will NEVER stay at a Comfort Inn EVER again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! AND will DEFINITELY be sharing this experience with EVERYONE on Facebook and any place else I can post!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Newer hotel, nice property, terrible parking.”
Reviews.Author: gulliver4u
Reviews.Content: This is a newer property with a lot of nice upgrades. Marble in the lobby. Nice furniture. But, parking was a disaster. the hotel offers "park and fly" room rates, so everybody and their brother drives in, parks, stays the night and takes the shuttle to the airport. Leaving their car at the hotel. The parking lot was overflowing out into the street and I was doing good to get a spot.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mrhorn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room for a recent trip to Boston. We called to confirm our reservation before we left and were told they did not have a reservation for us. We had unknowingly called the "Comfort Inn and Suites" rather than the "Comfor Suites". Assuming they had just lost our reservations, we booked a new room and had a great trip. When we got home, we discovered we had been billed by the "Comfort Suites" for a room we never used. Even though they are both owned by Choice Hotels and use the same system, the manager at the Comfort Suites would not refund us the $100 plus dollars for the room we never used. They admitted that "this happens often and is a real problem" the manager was very unhelpful. Indy has many Comfort Inn's, Comfort Suites, and Comfort Inn and Suites but yet they will not help customers who mix up the names. The room would have had too have been more like a Marriott for us to forgive this and I believe my wife and I will not stay with "Comfort" anything in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for business in Indianapolis Area”
Reviews.Author: donkane
Reviews.Content: Truly a great hotel, not congested in downtown area. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ustb_jiangmin
Reviews.Content: the clerks here are friendly, kind. the facility is good and living here is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice location, good service”
Reviews.Author: travelwithmydear
Reviews.Content: We did a park, sleep, fly here in March 2011. Everything went smooth. The staff was nice and helpful. Room was clean and spacious. The hotel is basically new. We had no trouble with parking and the airport shuttle was fine. Indy's airport is very nice, by the way. The hotel is situated with a bunch of others and could be hard to find without gps or very good directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, terrible parking lot in the snow”
Reviews.Author: Ian_The_Brit
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel as a park, sleep, fly during my recent trip to Mexico during the recent bad weather in the Midwest. i hve to say that the hotel & room was really nice. However upon my return last Saturday (We arrived back at midnight) it took me almost 30 minutes to get out of the parking lot as the lot was so badly covered in snow & ice that it was almost impossible to walk in the lot let alone drive a vehicle. I noticed that other hotels in the vicinity had their lots completely cleared, but obviously the local management here did not seem to think it was quite such an important task to ensure their guests had that particular 'luxury'.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Comfort Suites Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: johnham
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum Choice Privileges member and have never experienced anything close to this in all of my Choice stays over the years. My wife and I checked into our room late on a Saturday night. After crawling into the bed, we noticed something ticking us. I turned the lights on and noticed numerous hairs on the sheet. Since it was late, we decided to remove the sheet and sleep on top of the bedspread. In the morning, I decided to inspect the sheet. At this time, I discovered what appeared to be fecal matter on the sheet we had removed. We immediately left the room and I notified the person working the desk that morning. He was rude and was obviously not able to assist us. I decided to wait and contact management during normal business hours. I sent an email detailing our experience and only asking for a refund of the reward points we had used for this stay. A few days later, I received an email from one of the property managers. She was very condescending and stated if we had notified the desk that night, they would have addressed it. If I had noticed the fecal matter that night, we would have simply left. She further stated she would not be refunding our points but would hope I would stay there again in the future. I contacted Choice Hotels directly and the gentleman agreed that this was a completely unacceptable response. He refunded my points and assured me that this incident would be notated. I stay in over 100 Choice Properties a year and have never filed a complaint. Not only was the condition of the room deplorable, the responses from the management of this hotel made a bad situation terrible. I will continue to patronize Choice Hotels but will never step foot in this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and facility”
Reviews.Author: JMP1954
Reviews.Content: New hotel, large rooms, very clean, friendly staff. Good location for easy access to airport. Not many resturants near hotel but a 10-15 minute drive gets you to many options for food. Area seems very safe.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler38836
Reviews.Content: staff, beds, breakfast, pool, and fitness center all were very nice

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: tstippel
Reviews.Content: Been staying at this hotel this year quite a bit. Have been on a buisness trip and have stayed for about a total of 12 weeks. I can tell you I have seen it all here. Beds are great, HD TV's, great free breakfest, and freindly staff. I highly recommend this hotel and hope my next buisness trip out for so long, I can find one just like it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: takingavacation
Reviews.Content: This Comfort Suite hotel was exceptionally clean and comfortable. It seemed new so we ask and the front desk clerk said they had just passed their one year anniversary. The staff was extremely nice and helpful and the free breakfast was more than sufficient. We stayed here overnight on a long trip and found it to be a wonderful stop to rest and relax. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An Incredible staff and beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jqueen568
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay every time, Staff and amenities are the best. Quiet, friendly a true hidden gem in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not best for leisure or family travelers but likely an excellent hotel for busy business travelers.”
Reviews.Author: shawnee32
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very friendly, helpful employees who offer great service. Newer hotel, so a modern, updated appearance and amenities. Very comfortable beds with comfortable sheets, blankets, and comforters. Cons: Breakfast offered is apple juice and orange juice, three different kinds of cereal (Fruit Loops, Rice Krispies, and Frosted Flakes), fruit, mini muffins and assorted small pastries and bagels, and biscuits and gravy. The breakfast area is not kept stocked as people come in to eat, so if you arrive later in the morning (breakfast is served from 6:30 - 9:30) you are out of luck. I would say the breakfast would remind me of options you would have at a QuikTrip and was not sufficient to satisfy the appetites of myself, my husband, or our young children. If you are in a bind and need something more than a snack to eat, you are out of luck at this hotel. Very bad location. It is difficult to get to and is not near any restaurants or shopping areas. If you want some decent food or to be able to pick up some items, you will have to drive for a bit. No view. Not a huge deal for us, but, if it is of any matter to you, there is no view. So, to sum it up, I would say it would be an excellent hotel for a busy single traveler who has to eat on the go as it is a very nice hotel and is very near the airport. However, if you are traveling as a family and need decent meals and to be closer to shopping and attractions, I would look around.

Reviews.Title: “Wowowowowow Absolutely one of the amazing...”
Reviews.Author: Jaddo
Reviews.Content: Wowowowowow Absolutely one of the amazing stay I've ever had. This hotel was very elegantly stylish with a posh clean modern look! The rooms r even better I had a king suite and was upgraded to have a jacuzzi in the room, which made things even better. The room was just as stylish as the decoration of the hotel, there's a big flat screen tv and the bed are veryyy comfortable!!! Even though the hotel is next tot he airport, I heard nothing but quietness and slept comfortably!! Thus hotel is much better than the surrounding hotels next to it and worth every single penny!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayannl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we were in town to play a golf tournament at Brickyard Crossing. We got a great rate. The hotel is new and modern. The rooms are large with flat screen TVs. Excellent breakfast which is included in the price of the room. Plus a wonderful staff. It was also super quick to drive up to the Brickyard.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, convenient, and priced right”
Reviews.Author: asb5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just off the highway, down a side street, with lots of other hotels on both sides. It's very close to the airport. They have cookies available at check-in. The room is very nice, with a big king sized bed, desk, couch, flat screen TV, refrigerator, and microwave. We can hear a small amount of highway noise and plane noise, but it's really not much at all. The bed was very comfortable. My only problem was minor and was with the wireless; it kept stalling, getting slow. I kept restarting my computer's wireless connection, but nothing I was doing seemed to help. I didn't have to wait very long for web pages to load, but I did have to wait a few seconds. I was able to watch a show on hulu, so you know it wasn't horrible. (Well, at first it was, stalling every minute. But then I reset the wireless connection on my computer and it sped up. Before you start thinking it's my computer, we're on day 5 of a road trip, and this is the first hotel at which I've had a network problem.)

Reviews.Title: “Wow...Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: jhd28
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! We had 2 King beds, a fold out couch, frig, and microwave. Free parking while we flew. Nice front desk people.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: superllamamama
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here on our way from DC back to Missouri. I made the reservation on-line just a day or so before we stayed and was relying on the reviews to be correct. And they were! The hotel is beautiful and clean and smells fresh and new. The staff was so friendly and eager to be helpful. The beds were high and comfortable and there was a flat-screen tv. There was a sleeper sofa in the room that we didn't use, but it was nice for relaxing somewhere besides the bed. We hated to leave in the morning! Be aware that it is a little tricky to find the turn-in. I had directions from AAA trip-tik that were very accurate, but the sign at the road you turn in on is temporary and the wind was making the top curl down and cover part of it. We had to turn around and come back to it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OH_Tom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at numerous Comfort Inns and Comfort Suites over the years while traveling on business. I must say this hotel is the nicest Comfort Inn/Suites I have seen. Our family spent the night at this hotel and took advantage of their "Stay and Fly" package. We were very impressed with this facility. This hotel is almost new--it still had a "new building" smell. Our room was oversized, with two queen beds, a sofa, and an LCD TV. The bedding was high quality and the mattresses were very comfortable. The room was extremely well appointed, and I can honestly say our room was nicer than some rooms we have had at hotels costing much, much more per night. The front desk employees were extremely friendly and courteous. Unfortunately, we had an early flight and we did not get to partake of the free breakfast, so I cannot comment on its quality. If I had to criticize the hotel in any way, I would say they need more parking. They offer a nice "Stay and Fly" package and they seem to have a lot of people taking advantage of it (including our family). Several guests had to park in non parking spaces the night we stayed. I don't know if that happens regularly but I was glad we didn't arrive at the hotel later in the evening or there may have been no room to take advantage of the "Stay and Fly" feature. In summary, we would readily stay at this hotel again and would heartily recommend it to anyone. Kudos to their staff and management for a job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice! Better than our Vegas room!”
Reviews.Author: rndgirl
Reviews.Content: We have been on the road for 11 days with 3 children. We have stayed in 3 separate hotels along our way. This was the best EVER! Rooms were huge! Beds were comfy and big. breakfast was good,with a big selection. Kids were happy to eat eggs,sausage on an english muffin. Service was excellent. Pool was good size for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, close to airport, great service”
Reviews.Author: canatrace
Reviews.Content: Needed 1 night here after a late flight into Indy. Originally booked at microtel, but found this hotel for similar price - what a great deal. Hotel is only about a year old, so nice and clean and modern with flat panel TV and comfortable beds and even room for a couch. Nice size room. Attendants at check in were super helpful. We had the vending machine eat our dollars, and attendant quickly refunded us our money with no hassle. It is your typical morning hotel breakfast, nothing to write home about - but it was included so no complaints. would definitely stay here again. Free shuttle to and from airport as well - and they weren't super busy so were able to pick us up and take us to airport right away.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: derekjeter
Reviews.Content: This property is beautiful, clean and a great value. The quality of the rooms and the staff were of superior rating. Others who left comments failed to mention how spacious the rooms are! The hotel shuttle is accommodating and very convenient for those who seek transportation to and from the airport. I highly recommend this hotel. The pictures posted by the hotel accurately depict the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Very new, very nice, airport noise could be a problem”
Reviews.Author: LittleBoyBrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on a long road trip. Arrived after midnight and departed right after breakfast, so impressions are somewhat limited. Parking was limited and some cars were parked far down the entrance road, though the front desk attendant told me to feel free to park at the front door, as long as I left room for the shuttle bus. It was a windy and brisk night, this was appreciated. The hotel is very new and the king room was nicely appointed with flat screen TV, very comfortable bed, sleeper sofa. The hotel is adjacent to I-465, so there was some road noise, although with the AC fan on it was not objectionable to me (I am a heavy sleeper, normally). I like it when the HVAC system fan can be turned on and left on. Sometime early in the morning the Fed Ex jets from IND began to leave, and this was a bit more noticeable. Light sleepers might have issues here. The breakfast bar was similar to other Comfort Suites I have visited. Large dining room, but only five tables, they could use more. The hostess attending the bar was not very attentive, some items took a while to be replenished, and the biscuits and eggs were cold. My son likes the fresh waffles, and I am basically a bagel and oatmeal guy, and these were fine. If you value clean and comfortable you will like this hotel, but light sleepers might beware.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel...good shuttle”
Reviews.Author: angi1968
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, and I spent just one night at this location. We had a morning flight from the Indianapolis airport. We arrived on Saturday afternoon around 2 pm and was allowed to check in @ that time. The room was very large...we had a king size bed with a sofa sleeper. The parking lot was almost full when we arrived. Several cars were parked along both sides of the driveway which only left a narrow path down the drive to the hotel. We found a parking spot in the lot and chose to order dinner and have it delivered so we wouldn't lose the spot. We were using the Park and Fly program also so we didn't want our vehicle parked on the driveway while we were away...thought that our side mirror might be missing when we returned. The hotel is new and very clean. The walls are somewhat thin and you could easily hear conversations from the room next door, but overall it was a nice place. Breakfast was the usual for the Comfort Suites chain...Belgian waffles, cereal, toast, eggs,biscuits and sausage gravy. The biscuits and eggs were still somewhat frozen and had to be microwaved, but were did arrive in the breakfast area right at 6:30 am when breakfast started. We were the only ones on the shuttle to the airport and had plenty of room. The drive from hotel to airport approximately 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: FWA2006
Reviews.Content: I had never done a stay and park before so I was nervous about what kind of hotel I would get near the airport at a reasonable rate. I made the reservation on line but when I called for directions the front desk person was very personable and answered all my questions. Check in and out was quick and friendly. The room was very nice with a little sitting area and a comfortable bed. It seems strange that you put a sign in your car window saying when you'll be gone but my car was perfect when I got back. This hotel is the farthest in on the road of airport hotels. It's quiet and clean. The breakfast buffet is normal (good) and the shuttle drivers efficient and polite. I'd stay here again. It was a great deal for an early flight out of Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: EasyRider073
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with a friendly front desk staff. Breakfast was okay, but loved this place.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Suites Indianapolis Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 2750 Fortune Circle West, Indianapolis, IN 46241
